item.title: Operating Inference as Infrastructure: A GenAI Implementation Journal
item.description:
Operating Inference as Infrastructure

This project started as a side project.

But from the beginning, I made a deliberate choice:
Even as a solo engineer, AI integration would be treated as production infrastructure, not as a feature experiment.

The objective was not to “connect an LLM”.

The objective was to design inference as a first-class platform capability inside the product, so that we can easily onboard new functions that will help me with my business needs.

item.title: From Noise to 100% Reliability: A GenAI Implementation Journal
item.description:
Objective: Architecting a High-Reliability GenAI Pipeline

The goal of this article is to detail the methodology and reasoning behind implementing a generative AI treatment for data extraction from raw pixels.

The use case is very concrete: I run a Trading Card Game (TCG) website with about 14,000 monthly visitors. I needed to automate the extraction of data from card illustrations—specifically, the illustrators’ names, which are not readily available in any database. While my site is small, it serves as my personal Engineering Laboratory for experimenting with “Enterprise-grade” technology integrations.
